articles.content:
Stop to Expansion of U.S. Military Base Demanded in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- The All-People Measure Committee for Checking the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek of south Korea reportedly issued on June 16 a statement titled "The government should totally reexamine the plan for the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek and ensure a peaceful all-people meeting".
 The statement said: The "government" is going ahead with the expansion of the U.S. military base in accordance with the plan worked out by the U.S. despite the fact that the injustice of the agreement on the transfer of the U.S. military base has been clearly proved since its conclusion and over 80 percent of the people are demanding the renegotiation on it. This cannot be construed otherwise than a crazy action.    
 The statement demanded the "government" cancel the above-said plan, totally renegotiate it with the U.S. and immediately withdraw military and police forces from the areas of Taechu-ri and Todu-ri.

articles.title: Special Internet Homepage Opens
articles.content:
Special Internet Homepage Opens 
   Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- A special Internet homepage "Red Banner of Songun" opened by the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on June 12 on the occasions of the 42nd anniversary of Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the 6th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
 The homepage carried pictures of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and photos showing the Songun leadership exploits of Kim Jong Il.    
 It posted articles entitled "Great history of revolutionary activities of Comrade Kim Jong Il", "Glorious 42 years of the Songun Sun", "On achieving the reunification of Korea under the banner of "By our nation itself", "The U.S. imperialists provoked the Korean war" and others.

articles.content:
GIs' Massacres of Iraqi Civilians Denounced in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean People's Action against Troop Dispatch reportedly issued a statement on June 13 denouncing the United States for committing inhumane massacres of civilians.
 The statement demanded the U.S. make a thoroughgoing probe into the truth behind the massacres of Iraqi civilians, call those involved in the massacres to account and sternly punish them, close all sorts of detention facilities and stop killing innocent civilians.

Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Ambassador of New Zealand
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Ambassador of New Zealand
   Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Jane Coombs, ambassador e.p. of New Zealand to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
 On hand were Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and staff members of the embassy of New Zealand.    
 After receiving the credentials Kim Yong Nam had a conversation with the ambassador.

articles.title: Delegation of "Love-Neighbor Society" of S. Korea Here
articles.content:
Delegation of "Love-Neighbor Society" of S. Korea Here
   Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the "Love-Neighbor Society" of south Korea led by Chairman Ri Il Ha arrived here Wednesday.
 It was greeted at the airport by Jong Tok Gi, vice-chairman of the National Reconciliation Council, and others.
